oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Selfies und Stories. Authentizität und Banalität des narrativen Selbst in Social Media
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Martínez, Matías
Weixler, Antonius
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper discusses autobiographical representations and constructions of the self in two prominent recent devices of social media, namely Selfies and Stories. Selfies taken during the users‘ vacations strive to convey the impression of informal and individual authenticity by applying, paradoxically, highly conventional features. Snapchat’s Stories exhibit everyday situations of a surprisingly evanescent and banal nature. Both of these social media dispositives depict ‚instantaneous selfs’ that lack diachronic narrative features; ‚shared selfs‘ that legitimize themselves through social affiliation rather than deviation; ‚automatic selfs‘ that are co-authored by algorithmic procedures.
